intro: Cyclostemon gitingensis, commonly known as the Gitingensis cyclostemon, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves and showy, lantern-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in lowland forests. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in clusters and attract various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
